fqTitle: Will Meta be allowed to use data from Brazil to train its AI models by July 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Meta receives permission from Brazil's national data protection authority to use data originating in Brazil to train its AI models. The permission must be confirmed through official statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If no such permission is granted by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Ann Wilson announces cancer diagnosis, postpones Heart tour

The announcement must be made through official channels such as the band's website, social media, or reputable news sources. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: FDA approves a second Alzheimer's drug that can modestly slow disease

The number of prescriptions must be verified by official reports from Eli Lilly or other reputable medical sources. If the number of prescriptions is not confirmed to exceed 10,000 by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: In wake of Supreme Court ruling, Biden administration tells doctors to provide emergency abortions
articleDescription: The Democratic Biden administration is telling emergency room doctors they must perform emergency abortions when necessary to save a pregnant woman’s health. That's following last week's 6-3 Supreme Court ruling that failed to settle a legal dispute over whet…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) The Biden administration told emergency room doctors they must perform emergency abortions when necessary to save a pregnant womans health, following last weeks Supreme Court ruling t… [+4400 chars]

fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is a legal challenge filed against the Biden administration's directive that emergency room doctors must perform emergency abortions when necessary to save a pregnant woman's health. The legal challenge must be confirmed by court filings or reported by at least two reputable news sources such as The New York Times or Reuters. If no such legal challenge is filed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

If no state explicitly refuses to comply by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

The ruling must be reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such ruling is issued by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Google falling short of important climate target, cites electricity needs of AI
articleDescription: Google, which has an ambitious plan to address climate change with cleaner operations, came nowhere close to its goals last year, according to the company’s annual Environmental Report Tuesday. Instead of going down, its emissions grew 13% in 2023. The tech g…
articleContent:
Three years ago, Google set an ambitious plan to address climate change by going net zero, meaning it would release no more climate-changing gases into the air than it removes, by 2030.
But a report… [+4601 chars]
fqTitle: Will Google reduce its carbon emissions in 2024 compared to 2023?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google reports in its annual Environmental Report or any other official statement that its carbon emissions for the year 2024 are lower than those for the year 2023. If no such reduction is reported, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: US to pay Moderna $176 million to develop pandemic flu vaccine

Confirmation must come from official statements by Moderna or the U.S. government, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such confirmation is available by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Court orders white nationalists to pay $2M more for Charlottesville Unite the Right violence
articleDescription: A jury ordered white nationalist leaders and organizations to pay a total of more than $26 million in damages to people who had suffered physical or emotional injuries during the event.
articleContent: RICHMOND Four years after violence erupted during the 2017 Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville, a jury ordered white nationalist leaders and organizations to pay a total of more than $26 million… [+10107 chars]
fqTitle: Will any of the white nationalist leaders involved in the Charlottesville Unite the Right rally appeal the $26 million damages ruling by July 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, any of the white nationalist leaders or organizations ordered to pay more than $26 million in damages for the 2017 Charlottesville Unite the Right rally file an appeal against the ruling. The appeal must be confirmed through official court records or credible news sources. If no appeal is filed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

If Beryl remains a Category 5 hurricane or is no longer active without being downgraded by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.
